definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]

sentences.english: So who is the debonair looking guy in the photograph above?
sentences.chinese: 誰是我們在上面照片中看到的那個溫文爾雅的人呢？

sentences.english: She is a cultured and bright girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個溫文爾雅，聰明伶俐的女孩。

sentences.english: For the first time her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentences.chinese: 她溫文爾雅的外表第一次露出破綻。

sentences.english: Her only asset was a gentle nature.
sentences.chinese: 她唯一的可貴之處是溫文爾雅的性情。

sentences.english: The little girl isgentleandcultivatedand everybody likes her.
sentences.chinese: 這小姑娘溫文爾雅，大家都很喜歡她。

sentences.english: Then, last of all, I desiderate urbanity.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我渴望練就溫文爾雅的性情。

sentences.english: I like it like the small white rabbit, gentle, naughty lovely personality.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡小白兔，喜歡它溫文爾雅，淘氣可愛的性格。

sentences.english: On can always be kind to people one cares nothing about.
sentences.chinese: 對於哪些偶們漠不關心地人，偶們總能做到溫文爾雅。

sentences.english: She took a glasses, talk in class to stomach.
sentences.chinese: 她帶着一個眼鏡，講起課來溫文爾雅。

sentences.english: My new teacher is a very gentle person.
sentences.chinese: 我的新老師是一個溫文爾雅的人。

sentences.english: He was a bear of a man, but kind and gentle.
sentences.chinese: 他是個長得粗獷的男人，但舉止溫文爾雅。

sentences.english: The people of this town are, for the most part, quiet and well-behaved.
sentences.chinese: 這個鎮上的人大多溫文爾雅，彬彬有禮。

sentences.english: Being gentle and cultivated is just a scholar's attitude.
sentences.chinese: 溫文爾雅正是學者的態度。

sentences.english: I had always been aware of a frame of malevolence under his urbanity.
sentences.chinese: 我常常覺察到，在他溫文爾雅的下面掩藏着一種惡意。
對於這個溫文爾雅的超級間諜來說似乎不大可能。

sentences.english: JAPANESE traffic cops were until recently a genteel bunch.
sentences.chinese: 不久之前日本的交通警察還是溫文爾雅的一羣人。

definition: full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
